meanings.definition: To adjust or manipulate in a skillful manner.
meanings.sent1: She was jiggering the settings on the machine to make it work better.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys jiggering with old gadgets to see if he can fix them.
meanings.sent3: The magician was jiggering with his hat, trying to pull out a rabbit.
meanings.sent4: The mechanic's hands moved swiftly, jiggering the engine back to life.
meanings.sent5: Her fingers expertly jiggered the lock open in seconds.

meanings.definition: A device for shaping or forming objects.
meanings.sent1: The potter used a jiggering tool to create the perfect curve in the clay.
meanings.sent2: The sculptor's favorite jiggering device helped him sculpt intricate details.
meanings.sent3: The chef's new jiggering gadget made cutting vegetables a breeze.
meanings.sent4: The carpenter's jiggering machine crafted flawless wooden legs for the table.
meanings.sent5: The artist's jiggering tool allowed for precise shaping of the sculpture.

meanings.definition: The act of altering or modifying something.
meanings.sent1: The jiggering of the recipe resulted in a delicious new dish.
meanings.sent2: His constant jiggering of the design eventually led to a breakthrough.
meanings.sent3: The jiggering of the plan caused confusion among the team.
meanings.sent4: The jiggering of the schedule made it difficult to keep track of appointments.
meanings.sent5: The jiggering of the rules brought about a fairer system for everyone.
